title: (x) Familiar looking serif - Ascender Serif {Indra}
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130307143701im_/http:/typophile.com/files/img004_4464.jpg)

Wtfont doesn't even come close, and TypeNav seems to be down atm. Any thoughts on this one?
author: mike.j

comments.content:
I believe this is [Foundry Form Serif](http://web.archive.org/web/20130307143701/http:/www.foundrytypes.co.uk/).  
Similar: [FF Celeste](http://web.archive.org/web/20130307143701/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontfont/ff_celeste_ot_1/), [FF Page Serif](http://web.archive.org/web/20130307143701/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontfont/ff_page_serif_ot/), and [ITC Charlotte](http://web.archive.org/web/20130307143701/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/itc/charlotte_serif_std_virtual/)

Thanks for the reply Stephen, its the closest one i could find as well, but unfortunately its not a perfect match. Take a close look at the a & b for example, also the horizontal 'serif parts'are slanted in foundry form serif, and are really horizontal in this sample.

I ran your image through the recognition component of our (soon to be released) font manager ( [http://www.typedna.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20130307143701/http:/www.typedna.com/ "http://www.typedna.com")), and based our database..this is a similar match (not the exact):

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130307143701im_/http:/typophile.com/files/res_3722.jpg)

Let me know if you need other fonts that are similar, as I can provide a list of further matches. If you are interested in registering as a beta tester for our software please visit [http://www.typedna.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20130307143701/http:/www.typedna.com/ "http://www.typedna.com"), this will allow you to play around with our recognition software first-hand and see how font manager differs from those currently available.

Thanks, Darren. I've signed up to beta.

xen - What's the source of this image? It could very well be custom.
Great idea Stephen. I will put a post up shortly requesting Beta testers, Darren.
I've been schooled by Prof. Kupferschmid.

Nice one kupfers that seems to be spot on!

As for the source it was a newspaper ad for a quality label from the Belgian Government :)
